Text saved: Asteroids are rocks that fly through space. Some of these rocks are called 'Potentially Hazardous Asteroids'. This means they can pass close to Earth's orbit, which is its path around the sun. They can come within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth. NASA has made a map of 1,400 of these asteroids. However, NASA does not think any of them will be a threat in the next one hundred years. With the technology we have now, NASA can follow these objects. They can also predict a possible impact. An impact is when an asteroid hits something. If this happens, there are two defence solutions that could be used to protect Earth.
